text: Armina neapolitana is a species of sea slug, a nudibranch, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Arminidae.Gofas, S. (2010). Armina neapolitana (delle Chiaje, 1824). In: Bouchet, P.; Gofas, S.; Rosenberg, G. (2010) World Marine Mollusca database. Accessed through: World Register of Marine Species at http://www.marinespecies.org/aphia.php?p=taxdetails&id;=138806 on 2012-04-15 ==Distribution== This species occurs in European waters and in the Mediterranean Sea. ==References== * Gofas, S.; Le Renard, J.; Bouchet, P. (2001). Mollusca, in: Costello, M.J. et al. (Ed.) (2001). European register of marine species: a check-list of the marine species in Europe and a bibliography of guides to their identification. Collection Patrimoines Naturels, 50: pp. 180–213 Category:Arminidae Category:Gastropods described in 1824 Category:Taxa named by Stefano delle Chiaje
title: Armina neapolitana
